note.p: Birth: Queen's Crescent, Glasgow, Scotland (02 October 1852)

Career: Assistant, Chemical Department, Glasgow University (1874); Professor of Chemistry, University of Bristol (1880); Professor of General Chemistry, University College, London (1887-1902); discovered argon, helium, neon, crypton and xenon; Professor of Chemistry, University College, London.
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1916-1917 vol 93 pp xlii-liv, plate, signed by J N C
